title: A forum strictly for fangames.
content:
EDIT: The forum is up, here it is: [url=http://fortvortabella.commanderkeen.org/forum/index.php]fortvortabella.commanderk.../index.php[/url]

I've been told there are a lot of people who make fangames, but they don't say anything on PCKF... So I wanted to make a forum where fangame builders could settle down and help each other out, and give eachother much needed morale boosts when something is getting to them.

I was wondering how many people would be interested in joining an fangame only forum. The forum would exist to help fangame makers get their games done.

It would basically have a links to useful resources, to a place to show off the latest things you've done with your fangames, to asking advice on programming.

I've go the forum created.. I just need to figure out how to work the damn thing, so until then, I'm just giving everyone a head's up.


The people who I think may be interested are:

Damien SR
Joe Capricorn
Shadow Master
Apocalypse Gohan
Afgncaaps
Vitamin Zach
Lititude
z hyphen one
szevvy
Too Much Time to Spare
Zero Diamond
Lava89
MortimerinBlack
Malvineous
freeyorp101
duke4e
lv4n
Commander Spleen
Genious314
DSL
Q90


I realize I could have some modders mixed up with fangamers, but this is a potential list of viable members.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: A forum strictly for fangames.
content:
Yeah, I guess I'd be interested. I'm more of a modder, since I haven't actually *finished* a fangame yet, but yeah, sounds like a good idea.

Besides, I can help people out with graphics.
And, I know a LOT of things people can do to improve thier games.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: A forum strictly for fangames.
content:
I'm going to have to talk to Xtra about getting some forum space on Spatang, because this forumhoster.com is a bunch of bullshit. They aren't even allowing me to log into my own fucling forum with my admin account... So they can kiss my ass.


So, I'll talk to Xtra when I can.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: A forum strictly for fangames.
content:
Can you maybe speak to Andy and get a forum created over at Keen:Modding or something instead? It's just that having yet another login and password is a bit of a hassle, not to mention remembering to regularly check another forum...

If you get it created at K:M then most of us already have accounts there.

Mind you, the "Unofficial games" forum here will probably do the trick nicely for fangames and even fangame-related programming.

title: Re: A forum strictly for fangames.
content:

Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: *Sigh*
content:
Whatever happened to moving this forum?? Where did eK even go?
I think it'd be best just to get an actual domain and everything and have PCKF and K:M (and this fangame one) all in one place. I know its been said so many times before, but seriously, it was supposed to move over a year ago!!-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: *Sigh*
content:
Malv --that's exactly what I'm trying to get away from: modding.

This forum may work for people who like getting biyearly gaming reports, but for people who like more timely reactions, I think a new forum is in order.

After all, that's what K:M was for, wasn't it? To get away from here and focus on a specific issue?

'Cides, getting a new account isn't exactly time consuming if you want to get the help. Actually, I don't want people who are too lazy to register. That kind of laziness is what I'm attempting to exterminate.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: *Sigh*
content:
But have you tried asking any questions like this in those forums? Sure the activity is low, but whenever I post a topic it only takes a day or so for the responses to build up. I don't think the forum format is really suited for anything much beyond that.

I think that if you start a new forum you'll get a few enthusiastic people joining, but you have to keep in mind that enthusiasm doesn't necessarily equal knowledge. I mean - picking someone at random - you could argue that Szevvy knows his stuff when it comes to game formats, but the time between his posts is measured in weeks at best. If you want that experience, you won't get it quickly.

getting a new account isn't exactly time consuming if you want to get the help

True, but do you really want a forum full of people needing help and nobody who knows any answers to the questions? When you're looking for help yourself, the last thing you want to look through is other people's unanswered questions...

Don't get me wrong, if you think it deserves a forum on its own then by all means set one up and see what happens - I just think you'll have a bit of trouble convincing people why they should join another forum that has quite a bit of overlap with one they're already part of.

title: Re: *Sigh*
content:
I agree, but K:M certainly isn't lacking in posts.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: A forum strictly for fangames.
content:
Well, I'm writing a game engine that could be used for Keen fan-games. However, I'm learning C/C++ at the same time I write some code, so I guess I couldn't talk much about it in a fangame forum.

But I'd like to have such a forum for receiving suggestions and wish-lists. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

EDIT: or help with writing a physics engine pretty similar to Keen: G. Galaxy! engine.[hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

title: Re: A forum strictly for fangames.
content:
"Can you maybe speak to Andy and get a forum created over at Keen:Modding or something instead?"
No! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-no.gif[/img] I'd never want that to happen, these are two very different things. There's a big difference enough in modder and fan game maker attitudes, not to mention the real differences such as modifying a game and having its limits versus creating something new from scratch with no limits.

Anyways, it might be not that bad idea, in case this UKG area here isn't working. I'm probablyn not going to join, as I'm not interested in making fan games that much, but I'll browse it once in a while.

And the forum moving -- that's in the hands of Chog'all, still, and I believe it will happen one day.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: A forum strictly for fangames.
content:
Djaser, I have a vague feeling you're going to be served those words on a platter sometime. I was of a similar opinion when Globox first suggested the idea, but it looks as though it could become a valuable resource.

The fact is, it's not just carving out part of the PCKF and creating some kind of sect or faction. It doesn't just concern Keen fangames, but also game development in general.

Sooner or later, time vill tell.

title: Unoffcial Keen Games is still needed....
content:
Well, I think the site is really well made, and I think it will help the Keen fangame community. Now how it actually effecting this community I don't know.

The downside, is that less people will come here I think and post projects

The upside about the Barricades is that it's more concentrated.

And I don't think the unofficial Keen game section of this board is useless either, maybe this site could be where people post their ideas, and if they are really really serious about continuing the project, they can go over to the barricades? Something like that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

One thing I noticed, is that most of the people who posted on my Keen 3D thread here have migrated over to the Barricades and posted comments about my project there.

I don't mind either way, and I am going to continue posting my project updates there and here. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
